New Records: Harry Kane drew level with Michael Owen and Wayne Rooney as the players to score for England at the most major tournaments, with four apiece.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored a goal in the 18th minute
Morten Hjulmand scored a goal for Denmark in the 34th minute
Jude Bellingham barely factored on Thursday against Denmark's physical midfield
Foden, who rang a shot off the post in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: England must wait to secure a berth in the knockout stage of Euro 2024
Post-Match Reflections: Kane said 'We know we can improve', 'I know there will probably be loads of noise and a bit of disappointment back home but we experienced this in the last Euros as well.'
Hjulmand said 'It hasn't quite dawned on me yet -- to score a goal for Denmark at a major finals is really, really big, so of course I'm proud.'

Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg said 'I would have traded it for three points, We played well, we played smart, annoying that we couldn't get one to go in. We have a lot we can take with us, we have to keep looking ahead and do it, we have time.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The draw leaves the 2020 runners-up, previously touted as tournament favourites, at the top of Group C on four points, while Denmark are second on two after Slovenia's 1-1 draw with Serbia earlier.
England take on Slovenia in their final group game on Tuesday, while the Danes face Serbia on the same day, with all four teams still technically able to progress in the tournament.
